title: What is the differnce between flex and solo/duo
body: what is the difference between flex and solo/duo queue

replies.body:
Flex allows queuing as a solo player or 2, 3 or 5 player premade group.

Solo/Duo queue is just that, Solo/Duo only.
If you're referring to your last Diana game (the game played just before you posted this) that was a Flex Queue Game as far as my records show. Both teams had a duo and a trio.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Gehirn,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=LAPbteLI,comment-id=000000020000,timestamp=2017-01-04T01:14:54.584+0000)
>
> If you're referring to your last Diana game (the game played just before you posted this) that was a Flex Queue Game as far as my records show. Both teams had a duo and a trio.

Yeah sorry It appears that was my bad, my duo apparently chose flex and didnt tell me even though I said I wanted a duo for my S/D promos.
will the ranks be shared between them or are they seperate ranks? for e.g im bronze in flex que but in solo que im silver

Solo seems to be people of your ELO.

Flex matches plats with bronze.

its da bomb.
Flex will give you diamond enemy players while your team consists of gold and silver.

It's also notable that you can have two different ranks thanks to them.

You could be Silver 2 in Flex but Gold 3 in Solo.
which one would be better to play to prepare for next season

Both.
You can work on both ranks individually.

I'm playing Flex with any of my friends and taking it fairly casually, while I'm taking YoloQ as super serious.
the question that i wanna ask is already posted
